Japanese:
お主ら、
特工房に行ったらしいな。
English: It appears that you've been to the Special Workshop.

Japanese: ポーの奴に会ったのか？
English: Did you meet that damned Poe?
Yeah.

Japanese:
やつは
伝統を守り続けることを嫌い、
円工房を出た。
English: He hated obeying conventions, so he left the Circle Workshop.

Japanese:
科学技術とやらに
毒された男よ。
English: He was bewitched by scientific techniques.

Japanese:
伝統技術の呪縛にとらわれた
円工房には、もはや成長も
進歩もない。
English: {The Circle Workshop is being strangled by it's traditions, and will never be able to progress further.}

Japanese: やつは、ぬかしおったわ。
English: He used to spout such nonsense.

Japanese:
だがワシは
自分が間違っているとは
思わん。
English: But, I personally believe he was mistaken.

Japanese:
いいんじゃねぇの。
それで。
English: Well, that's fine, isn't it?

Japanese:
どっちかが間違ってる
わけじゃねえよ。
English: Either way, you're both entitled to your own opinions.

Japanese:
いや。
そうはいかん。
English: No. You're mistaken.

Japanese: やつに思い知らせなくては。
English: I need to teach him a lesson.

Japanese:
伝統を守ることは
「進歩を否定すること」
ではない。
English: Sticking to traditions is not {denying progress}.

Japanese:
やつに、それが
わからなかったとは、
寂しいことよ。
English: It's a sorry thing that he could never understand that.

Japanese:
だからこそ、ワシは特工房など
足元にも及ばんほど強いマリオ
ネーションギアを開発した。
English: That's why I developed a Marionation Gear that the Special Workshop will be no match for.

Japanese:
見てくれ。
蒸気の力を利用した
最強の人形じゃ。
English:
Observe.
Harnessing the power of steam, it's the strongest puppet.
The /c5Steam Mech Dover/c3.

Japanese: 古臭く見えるかもしれんが……
English: It may look old fashioned...

Japanese:
知っておるか？　実際のところ、
蒸気の生み出すパワーは、あら
ゆる動力の中でもトップクラス。
English: But did you know? It's a matter of fact that the energy produced by steam is the top-class amongst all other types of power.

Japanese:
/c5石炭をくべる/c3のが
ちょっと面倒じゃが、
パワーはすごいぞ。
English: /c5Throwing coal on the fire/c3 is a bit cumbersome, but the power it produces is most extraordinary

Japanese:
ポーのやつには、
これほどのものは作れまい。
English: That damned Poe would never be able to create a thing like this.

Japanese:
こいつを使って、
奴に思い知らせてやる。
English: I'll use it to teach him a lesson.

Japanese:
何だか、オモチャみたいにも
見えるぜ……。
English: It kinda looks like a kid's toy, somehow...

Japanese:
ふははは。
お主、何もわかっておらんな。
English:
Wah hah hah hah.
You know nothing, my boy.

Japanese:
こうみえて、この人形は、
おそろしい強さをもっておる。
English: Believe it or not, this puppet possesses tremendous strentgh.

Japanese:
お前たち、
こいつと勝負してみろ。
English: You should try engaging with it in a fight.

Japanese:
そうすれば、
この人形のすごさがわかる。
English: That way, you'll realise the might this puppet holds.

Japanese:
もし勝てれば、
２号機を売ってやってもいいぞ。
English: If you're victorious, I will sell you the next unit I build.

Japanese:
……まあ、
買うかどうかはともかく、
勝負は受けるぜ。
English: ...Well, I'm not sure whether we'll actually buy them or not, but we accept the challenge.
